Violation_Type: Failure to meet physical residency requirement
Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act and provided adequate reasons
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed 840 days of physical presence in Canada; required 1,095 days within four years prior to application
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge's decision was reasonable and adequately explained
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge assessed residency using strict count of days test and rejected alternative documentation
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged incorrect application of residency rules and inadequate reasoning by the Citizenship Judge
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, quality of residence, centralization of mode of existence
Procedural_Issue: Appeal filed under subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Used: Documentation submitted by applicant to support additional days of residence
Evidence_Assessed: Supporting documents for claimed residence deemed insufficient
Relief_Sought: Overturn of refusal and approval of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Applicant must be physically present in Canada for at least 1,095 days in the four years preceding application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to support use of alternative tests (quality of residence or centralization of mode of existence)
Outcome: Applicant remains ineligible for citizenship due to residency shortfall
Harm_Assessment: No harm from administrative decision; public interest in lawful citizenship adjudication upheld
Cause_Description: Applicant failed to meet minimum physical residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Handling: Judge reviewed but rejected additional documentation as inadequate
Evidence_Issues: Lack of verifiable evidence for claimed residence beyond 840 days
Residency_Compliance: Not met â€“ 347 days short under strict count method
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction under subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Assessment: Alternative tests not applicable due to insufficient supporting evidence
Decision_Rationale: No error in applying strict count of days; reasons were adequate though not perfect
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide sufficient, credible documentation to substantiate residence claims
